body: Have you tried removing /boost from your search path? Since your main.cpp is looking for `boost/thread.hpp` the boost directory will appear twice: `D:/Lib/boost-cmake/boost/boost/thread.hpp`

How stupid am I ! I remove the "boost" from my search path, then it can find the thread.hpp file. 
However, it seems clang cannot parse boost files properly.
I got too many errors:

D:/Lib/boost-cmake\boost/config/requires_threads.hpp:47,5 - Error - #error "Compiler threading support is not turned on. Please set the correct command line options for threading: -pthread (Linux), -pthreads (Solaris) or -mthreads (Mingw32)"
D:/Lib/boost-cmake\boost/mpl/if.hpp:131,1 - Error - pasting formed 'BOOST_PP_TUPLE_ELEM_E_2(', an invalid preprocessing token [Disable with -Wno-invalid-token-paste]

Boost works fine on OSX, so this is something you've not configured properly. Does boost compile on Windows with the standalone clang compiler? Did you try adding "-mthreads"?
I didn't try compiling Boost in windows with clang. Maybe clang can't do that.
A suggestion. There might be some definitions in the header files that you should define by using `"-D__OPTION__=VALUE"`.
